Description.val: Handles the Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data internal events

Comment.val: This component provides an interface for the user to perform Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data.The component does not expose any object. It has logic units for handling the Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data internal events.The source code for this component is available in the Add_On\UserFunctionality directory, so you can customize the screens of the component as you wish.

Description.val: Handles the Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data internal events

Comment.val: This component provides an interface for the user to perform Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data.The component does not expose any object. It has logic units for handling the Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data internal events.The source code for this component is available in the Add_On\UserFunctionality directory, so you can customize the screens of the component as you wish.

Text.valUnicode: Edit controls contain either variables or expressions, specified in the Value and Exp columns of the Data property

Comment.val:
1 Example On Control 1. import CustomPropertiesControl.xml 2. Execute generate web client 3. open After generate component do the following changes: 4. add the following code to CustomPropertiesControl.css .redClass{ background-color: #FF0000;} .blueClass{background-color:deepskyblue;} 5. add the following code to CustomPropertiesControl.html

{{ 'Control1 is gretter then 100'}}

{{ 'Control2 is gretter then 50'}}

=> while type number > 100 on control 1 and press Tab a red control label will be display with message (red control) while type number > 50 on control 2 and press shift Tab a blue

ExpSyntax.val: IF (Stat(0,'C'), 'it is created mode','its NOT creatd mode')

Comment.val:
2 Example On form (state function) 1. import CustomPropertiesForm.xml 2. Execute generate web client 3. open After generate component do the following changes: 4.. add the following code to CustomPropertiesForm.html

{{ (mg.getCustomProperty ('CustomPropertiesForm', 'IsCreatedModeState')) }}

==>>>>> while press on Create button the text that will be display :Task is in create mode while press on Modi button the text that will be display :Task is NOT in create mode

ExpSyntax.val: IF (Stat(0,'C'), 'Task is in create Mode','The task is NOT in create mode')
